q = int(input())
sort1 = list(map(int, input().split()))

def bubblesort(ary):
    cnt = 0
    for i in range(q-1):  # fix: avoid index out of range error
        for j in range(q-1, i, -1):  # fix: keep track of original index
            if ary[j] < ary[j+1]:  # fix: correct comparison
                ary[j], ary[j+1] = ary[j+1], ary[j]
                cnt += 1
    return (ary, cnt)

ary, cnt = bubblesort(sort1.copy())  # fix: avoid modifying the original list
print(" ".join(map(str, ary)))
print(cnt)
